result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D Patton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Joshua D Patton in court with attorney Michael Paul Jakus.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 6 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years - credit for 5 days, Extended Supervision: 4 years)  
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 - apply bail and refund balance. 
- DNA Surcharge of waived.     
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling if deemed appropriate by agent.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation. -
Sentencing hearing on June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua D Patton in court with attorney Michael Paul Jakus.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. State and Defense request a Presentence Investigation.  Court orders a Presentence investigation to be compiled and filed within 45 days. Court will set a sentencing date in 60 days. Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
